items.title: Nine people, including five children, stabbed to death in Suriname
items.description: Police detained the male suspect after shooting him in the leg, while two others are seriously injured.

items.title: Spaniards hurl flour, eggs and fireworks in mock battle
items.description: The annual food fight festival ''Els Enfarinats'' has left the Spanish town of Ibi covered in flour and egg shells.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro undergoes medical treatment for hiccups
items.description: The 70-year-old had suffered with the spasms for nine months, his wife says, and was already in hospital for hernia surgery.

items.title: French cinema actress Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
items.description: The actress was a symbol of sexual liberation in the 1950s but became increasingly controversial after making homophobic and racist slurs.

items.title: Three killed in Sweden as major storm sweeps across Nordic countries
items.description: Thousands of homes in parts of Finland, Sweden and Norway have been left without power.
